meanings.definition: An unidentified aircraft or missile, especially one detected as a blip on a radar screen.
meanings.sent1: The military detected several bogeys on their radar screen.
meanings.sent2: The radar operator spotted a bogey approaching from the north.
meanings.sent3: The radar screen showed a bogey flying in circles, confusing everyone.
meanings.sent4: The bogeys on the radar screen seemed to dance in a mysterious pattern.
meanings.sent5: The blip of the bogey on the radar screen blinked erratically, causing concern.

meanings.definition: A score of one over par on a hole in golf.
meanings.sent1: She recorded a bogey on the scorecard for the 9th hole.
meanings.sent2: Making a bogey on the last hole cost him the lead in the golf tournament.
meanings.sent3: His bogey on the easy hole made his friends chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The bogey on the scorecard felt like a missed opportunity for a birdie.
meanings.sent5: Scoring a bogey on the final hole left a bitter taste in her mouth.

meanings.definition: To score a bogey on a hole in golf.
meanings.sent1: He bogeys most of the holes due to his inconsistent putting.
meanings.sent2: If you bogey this hole, you might lose the match.
meanings.sent3: She always manages to bogey the toughest holes on the course.
meanings.sent4: Bogeying the hole felt like a missed opportunity for a better score.
meanings.sent5: Trying not to bogey the hole, he focused on his swing and aim.
